meanings.definition: The practice of funding a project or venture by raising small amounts of money from a large number of people, typically via the internet.
meanings.sent1: Crowdfunding helped the new business get the money it needed to start.
meanings.sent2: Many artists turn to crowdfunding to support their creative projects.
meanings.sent3: The crowdfunding campaign for the cat fashion show was a purr-fect success.
meanings.sent4: Her idea for a floating city was so innovative that crowdfunding flooded in like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The power of crowdfunding lies in the collective support of individuals coming together for a common goal.

meanings.definition: The act of soliciting financial contributions from a large number of people, especially from the online community.
meanings.sent1: Crowdfunding can be a great way to gather funds for a charitable cause.
meanings.sent2: After the hurricane, the community used crowdfunding to rebuild homes.
meanings.sent3: The crowdfunding plea for a unicorn farm raised eyebrows but also funds.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, crowdfunding has become a beacon of hope for many entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The magic of crowdfunding is how it transforms small donations into big impacts.
